intro: Conyza armeriifolia, commonly known as the smallflower blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are clustered in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Conyza armeriifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds.
